title: 1057-A
statement: A. Bmail Computer Networktime limit per test4 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputOnce upon a time there was only one router in the well-known company Bmail. Years went by and over time new routers were purchased. Every time they bought a new router, they connected it to one of the routers bought before it. You are given the values $$$p_i$$$ — the index of the router to which the $$$i$$$-th router was connected after being purchased ($$$p_i < i$$$).There are $$$n$$$ routers in Boogle in total now. Print the sequence of routers on the path from the first to the $$$n$$$-th router.InputThe first line contains integer number $$$n$$$ ($$$2 \\le n \\le 200000$$$) — the number of the routers. The following line contains $$$n-1$$$ integers $$$p_2, p_3, \\dots, p_n$$$ ($$$1 \\le p_i < i$$$), where $$$p_i$$$ is equal to index of the router to which the $$$i$$$-th was connected after purchase.OutputPrint the path from the $$$1$$$-st to the $$$n$$$-th router. It starts with $$$1$$$ and ends with $$$n$$$. All the elements in the path should be distinct.ExamplesInput81 1 2 2 3 2 5Output1 2 5 8Input61 2 3 4 5Output1 2 3 4 5 6Input71 1 2 3 4 3Output1 3 7

processed.result:
You are given a list of integers $p_2, p_3, ..., p_n$ where $p_i$ represents the index of the router the $i$-th router is connected to.  

Given $n$ (the total number of routers), find the path of routers from router 1 to router $n$. 

**Input:**

* The first line contains an integer $n$ ($2 \le n \le 200000$).
* The second line contains $n-1$ integers $p_2, p_3, ..., p_n$ ($1 \le p_i < i$).

**Output:**

Print the path of routers from router 1 to router $n$.
You are given a list of numbers representing how each router is connected to a previous router.  Find the path from the first router to the last router.
